text:
Miles Brown & Marsai Martin

Image Credit: Photographed By Ramona Rosales

AGES 13

KNOWN FOR Black-ish

When Brown transitioned from hip-hop dancing to acting at ?age 8, a battle broke out between Anthony Anderson and Kevin Hart over who'd recruit him as their TV son. Obviously, Brown went with ABC's Black-ish, on which he and Martin play twins. Now, the pair are breaking into film, with Brown starring in indie Emmett alongside Rita Wilson ?as Martin drives a new project ?of her own. After firing the agent who suggested she "just chill and take a break" during a hiatus, the executive producer of 2019's Little conceived the film, a ?twist on Tom Hanks' iconic comedy Big, and even convinced ?Issa Rae to star alongside her in the Universal feature.

BROWN

THE SHOW OR MOVIE THAT MADE ME WANT TO ACT Space Jam

I'D LOVE TO STAR IN A REMAKE OF … "Space Jam. I know you're doing it, LeBron!" LAST SHOW I BINGED "When Stranger Things season two came out I literally watched the whole season while my dad was shopping at some suit store. We were there for a long time!" MY HERO "LeBron. He's ?a good example of anything can happen, anything is possible."

HOW I SPENT MY FIRST PAYCHECK "It just went straight to my college savings."

WHEN I GROW UP, I WANT TO … "Be an NBA player."

MY GENERATION, IN A FEW WORDS, IS … "Passionate, because I feel like we've taken a lot of action for a lot of things that are going on right now. And I feel like a lot of the protests are kids from my generation, and I feel like that doesn't happen that often when you have kids who are trying to make things happen more than the adults are."

I'M JEALOUS OF REGULAR KIDS WHEN … "I see that they're just chillin' every day and coming home from school playing Fortnite. I'm like, 'Oh my God, you guys are already level 100 on this game that I can't play because I'm busy doing a TV show.'"

MARTIN

I WAS MOST STARSTRUCK BY … "Beyonce and President Obama, and I met them at the same time — the White House Easter Egg Roll — which was very overwhelming!"

MY HERO "My mom because she is the definition of black girl magic."

HOW I SPENT MY FIRST PAYCHECK "I went to the Gucci store."

WHEN I GROW UP, I WANT TO … "Inspire more girls to believe in themselves and create their own stuff at any age."

MY GENERATION, IN A FEW WORDS, IS … "Fearless. We just want to inspire young kids like us that they can do anything."

I'M JEALOUS OF REGULAR KIDS WHEN … "They get to walk around and no one recognizes them."
title: Hollywood’s Top 30 Stars Under Age 18

meta_data.description: Meet the young stars raking in the cash, racking up the followers and taking charge of their careers like no generation before them as The Hollywood Reporter scours the call sheets (and Coogan accounts) to anoint the child prodigies with bright futures and plans to impact the world far beyond the industry: "Kids are trying to make things happen more than the adults are.
meta_data.author: Bryn Sandberg
meta_data.title: Hollywood's Top 30 Stars Under Age 18
meta_data.body:
From Iain Armitage to Storm Reid, meet the under-18 stars raking in the cash ($250,000 an episode for the Stranger Things actors), racking up the followers (12 million on Instagram for Dance Moms alum Maddie Ziegler) and taking charge of their careers like no generation before them (Black-ish’s Marsai Martin is executive producing her own movie Little at Universal). As The Hollywood Reporter scours the call sheets and Coogan accounts to anoint the 30 child prodigies with bright futures and plans to impact the world far beyond the industry, these young stars say they just can't wait to be old enough to vote. As Black-ish castmember Miles Brown puts it, “Kids are trying to make things happen more than the adults are."


This story first appeared in the Aug. 8 issue of The Hollywood Reporter magazine. To receive the magazine, click here to subscribe.
